channel.title: Dream Controling
channel.description:
It is real, I mean. The possibilities of doing so is endless. I've been trying to do it for a couple weeks and finally I can do it. i can control everything and anything in my dreams. some of you may familiarize a dream as just watching a scene form in front of you and have no control or idea what's happening. Not me, not anymore. So do you believe in dream control? Or do you think it's bullshit?
Discuss

item.title: Dream Controling
item.dc:creator: @Zero187 Zero187
item.description:
@Zero187 wrote:

Lucid dreaming takes much discipline and practice. One must increase their overall awareness to a certain level before he or she is able to lucid dream. If you are very self-centered and don’t notice much going on around you, but instead are always in your own day-dream then you will not be able to lucid dream very easily. Practice by bringing out your awareness in every day life, and turning off the internal dialogue. Once the internal dialogue is silenced, you will start to notice more things and your senses will be keener. If you practice this daily, you will start noticing an increase in awareness in your dreams, to the point where you can control what you do.

At first when you become lucid in a dream, it will only last a few seconds and either fade to darkness and you will awake, or you will go back into another dream and lose you lucidity. The way to prevent this is to actually “spin” your dream self while in the dream if you are losing lucidity. When you are done spinning you will have a completely clear environment around you which will look as real as ever.

I’m 19 years old and have been practicing lucid dreaming for years now. If you have any questions feel free to ask me.

Interesting fact (somewhat offtopic):
Sorcerers hundreds of years ago were masters of lucid dreaming. They did not preform magic like Harry Potter (that’s obviously bullshit) but instead were masters of manipulation as they had a very strong link with human intent. They could read people and their emotions just by looking into their eyes - as the eyes are the links to your emotion. A very basic example is how one can tell when you are sad, or angry, or happy just by looking at the eyes, but the sorcerers were able to do this on a much more sophisticated level and could use this knowledge of what others were thinking and feeling to manipulate anyone. That is what true sorcery is, not the magic bullshit that we all associate it with.

Read full topic

item.title: Dream Controling
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:59, topic:222788”][quote author=cumescape link=topic=292611.msg2441332#msg2441332 date=1221478141]
If I could ever remember my dreams then I would have an opinion.
[/quote]

Practice your dream recall… You spend a lot of your life asleep, might as well be able to have fun dreams.[/quote]

Or you could put that time asleep to productive use, such as planning what you’re going to do the next day…

Btw, (Sorta responding to the question I asked) I had a dream a week or so ago where I died, then everything turned sepia-tone and my life started playing back to me in reverse. Seriously, very very disturbing.

item.title: Dream Controling
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:36, topic:222788”][quote author=dragonfire455 link=topic=292611.msg2362714#msg2362714 date=1217729122]

And you got this ability with only a few days practise? Nice.
What technique do you use? WILD, MILD, DILD or BTB, or perhaps something else?
[/quote]writing dream on my hand, check it every hour til i go to sleep or do the lightswitch effect, to do that you gotta think you will dream of you turning on a lightswitch in your dream, then when you do this and if the light comes on slow, gratz u got 99 dream control

That’s a great technique, but I highly doubt you came as far as you said you did. Not in a couple of weeks.

I was into lucid dreaming for a very long time. I could remember up to 5 dreams every night and I had over 200 pages of dream journals. I only started getting “good” at it when I quit it. I stopped because I smoke weed almost every night before bed, and I’m just too burnt out to do it. But it took me a few months just to get good dream recall at all. When I was able to become lucid it was like impossible to ever stay awake in your dreams, or you just completely forget and it becomes a normal dream again. “Hey sweet, I’m dreaming… Osht a purple elephant is eating my neighbor I better go save him…” then it becomes like a normal dream again lol.[/quote]I also WILD with a combination of WBTB, MILD, and even CALD. What i hate about WILD is the hallucinations, but it’s a sign i’m nearing a dream so no big deal.

Tip: when you wake up, don’t move and do what you do to wild (count like 1, I’m dreaming, 2 I’m dreaming and so on till you get to 100 I’m dreaming, then go back to one and so on) It’ll be much easier to wild. This is called Chaining

Read full topic

item.title: Dream Controling
item.dc:creator: @mod_blastman mod blastman
item.description:
@mod_blastman wrote:

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:223019”]I quite often know I’m in a dream and have free will but it always ends soon after I realise. Most of my dreams are only slightly better than real life, anyway, so there’s never much to do

I’d be much more interested in deciding what to dream about before I sleep *-|[/quote]
In reality, lucid dreaming does seem only a little better than real life. And it is somewhat possible to control WHAT dream you will have BEFORE you fall asleep. you have to think about it very hard.

Ex. I miss the summer resort i was at(campbell inn at roscoe,NY) so what i do is before i fall asleep is think about the place and the good time i had there. And 75% of the time, its the dream i have and i CAN control it.

Read full topic
